A math student is conducting an experiment to determine the average height of a group of 50 people. The student takes a sample of 10 people and finds their heights to be:

165 cm, 170 cm, 172 cm, 168 cm, 175 cm, 168 cm, 170 cm, 173 cm, 172 cm, 170 cm

The student wants to use bootstrap resampling to estimate the standard error of the mean height of the entire group. Generate 1000 bootstrap samples and calculate the mean height for each sample. Then estimate the standard error of the mean height for the whole group using the bootstrap samples.
message_2:
To perform bootstrap resampling, we will generate 1000 bootstrap samples by randomly selecting 10 heights from the original sample with replacement. Then, we will calculate the mean height for each sample and estimate the standard error of the mean height for the whole group using the bootstrap samples.

Here's the Python code to perform the bootstrap resampling:

```python
import numpy as np

# Original sample
heights = [165, 170, 172, 168, 175, 168, 170, 173, 172, 170]

# Number of bootstrap samples
n_bootstrap_samples = 1000

# Generate bootstrap samples
bootstrap_means = []
for _ in range(n_bootstrap_samples):
    bootstrap_sample = np.random.choice(heights, size=len(heights), replace=True)
    bootstrap_mean = np.mean(bootstrap_sample)
    bootstrap_means.append(bootstrap_mean)

# Calculate the standard error of the mean height
standard_error = np.std(bootstrap_means)

print("Estimated standard error of the mean height:", standard_error)
```

After running the code, we get the estimated standard error of the mean height for the whole group using the bootstrap samples:
